alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 24 at 5:43PM PST until December 25 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM PST MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Breaking waves 10 to 12 feet expected. * WHERE...Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, San Francisco Peninsula Coast, Northern Monterey Bay and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM PST Monday through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Expect dangerous water conditions including localized beach erosion. Large waves can sweep across the beach without warning, pulling people into the sea from rocks, jetties, and beaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Mainly northwest facing beaches are most at risk for large, turbulent shore break and strong currents. Northwest waves will gradually subside later in the day on Christmas.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
